question:
I have the Standard plan in the image below, and I just uploaded 60 equally sized files and got a message that I'm 100GB over the limit. I have 980 more files of the same size to upload. What is the average additional cost per file in dollar that goes over my current plan limit rounded to the nearest cent if I have to upgrade to the minimum possible plan to store them all? Answer with the following format: x.xx

[Note: There is an attached file at path: /Users/charles/spec_tool_call/gaia_dataset/level2/example_058/d8152ad6-e4d5-4c12-8bb7-8d57dc10c6de.png]

trajectory.question:
I have the Standard plan in the image below, and I just uploaded 60 equally sized files and got a message that I'm 100GB over the limit. I have 980 more files of the same size to upload. What is the average additional cost per file in dollar that goes over my current plan limit rounded to the nearest cent if I have to upgrade to the minimum possible plan to store them all? Answer with the following format: x.xx

[Note: There is an attached file at path: /Users/charles/spec_tool_call/gaia_dataset/level2/example_058/d8152ad6-e4d5-4c12-8bb7-8d57dc10c6de.png]

trajectory.actor_reasoning:
- Standard limit is 2 TB = 2000 GB.
- Sixty equal files put you 100 GB over, so total of those files is 2100 GB and each file is 2100/60 = 35 GB.
- Total for 1040 files: 1040 × 35 = 36400 GB = 36.4 TB, so you need Premium (50 TB) as the minimum plan.
- Additional monthly cost to upgrade: 39.99 − 9.99 = 30.00.
- Files that exceed Standard’s capacity: floor(2000/35) = 57 fit, so 1040 − 57 = 983 files are over the limit.
- Average additional cost per over-limit file: 30.00 ÷ 983 ≈ 0.03.

FINAL ANSWER: 0.03

- Standard limit is 2 TB = 2000 GB.
- Sixty equal files put you 100 GB over, so total of those files is 2100 GB and each file is 2100/60 = 35 GB.
- Total for 1040 files: 1040 × 35 = 36400 GB = 36.4 TB, so you need Premium (50 TB) as the minimum plan.
- Additional monthly cost to upgrade: 39.99 − 9.99 = 30.00.
- Files that exceed Standard’s capacity: floor(2000/35) = 57 fit, so 1040 − 57 = 983 files are over the limit.
- Average additional cost per over-limit file: 30.00 ÷ 983 ≈ 0.03.

FINAL ANSWER: 0.03
